user.title: Select Controller Type
user.description: Choose whether your Omada controller is self-hosted (local) or cloud-hosted.

cloud.title: Select Cloud Region
cloud.description: Select the region where your cloud-hosted Omada controller is located.

local.title: Local Controller URL
local.description: Enter the URL of your self-hosted Omada controller (e.g., https://192.168.1.100:8043 or https://omada.local:8043).

data_description.api_url: Full URL including protocol (http:// or https://)

credentials.title: Omada API Credentials
credentials.description:
Enter your Omada Open API credentials.

You can find these in your Omada controller:
1. Go to Settings > Platform Integration > Open API
2. Create a new application (Client Credentials Mode)
3. Copy the Client ID, Client Secret, and Omada ID

{controller_info}

data_description.omada_id: MSP ID or Customer ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_id: OAuth2 Client ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_secret: OAuth2 Client Secret from your Open API application

sites.title: Select Sites
sites.description:
Select which sites you want to monitor. Found {site_count} site(s).

You can select multiple sites or all of them.

reauth_confirm.title: [%key:common::config_flow::title::reauth%]
reauth_confirm.description: The Omada API credentials have expired or are invalid. Please re-enter your credentials to continue.

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to Omada API. Please check the URL and network connectivity.
error.invalid_auth: Invalid authentication credentials. Please check your Client ID, Client Secret, and Omada ID.
error.invalid_url: Invalid URL format. Please use http:// or https://
error.no_sites: No sites found on this controller. Please ensure at least one site is configured.
error.unknown: Unexpected error occurred. Please check logs for details.

abort.already_configured: This Omada controller is already configured
